content: I spoke to a group of students at Melbourne Uni - all health informatics students. I encouraged them all to spend some time contributing to open source projects. I agreed to post a list of possible ways to contribute on my blog. (both for developers, and non developers). If you have suggestions for contributions - preferably with particular projects in mind - please message me directly for inclusion in my blog. Projects need not be related to FHIR, but need to be related to health and IT/informatics
We already have few on fhir.js, fhir.py, fhirpath.js, fhirbase and starting fhirmapping.js - guys can join.
A new project with the goal to express the "likeness" of two profiles with working source code would be nice. Challenging, though ;-)

ieee.JPG partof.JPG
Hello,
i am currently working on a mapping of IEEE 11073-10207 to FHIR. I am wondering whether a room is meant as an organization or as a location. On one image the information i have to map is shown and on the other one how i would do that. I don't have an idea how to handle the room. Does someone have some advice for me?

Hi Kathrin, this stream is for announcements only, for discussions please post your question in one of the other streams. In case of doubt what stream to use, please post to the "implementers" stream.
